TO: Board of Directors January 23, 1961
FROM: W. G. Harley
RE: NAEB-JCET-NETRC
On January 9, the Executive Committee (Hull, Miles, Stone,
Harley) met in New York with Jack White and James Robertson to
discuss (1) a new start toward basic understanding and cooperation
with the Center and NAEB and (2) specifics of a joint plan for
reallocation of JCET Services.
The JCET situation, briefly stated, is that it was unable
to raise the money for its ong-range financing hence will be out
of funds for staff operation at the end of the month. The JCET
Board on January 3 voted to prepare plans for a modified JCET
on the Council would continue as a policy-determining group repreÂ¬
senting the ducational community in matters relating to ETV and
the staff function - legal, engineering, informational services -
would be assumed cooperatively by NAEB and NETRC, with the product
of this work made available to the Council as the basis for its
policy formulation. The presidents of these organizations were
asked to bring in a joint plan for a cooperative reallocation of
the JCET service functions.
White also announced at the January 3 meeting that the
Center was opening a Washington office and would employ David
Stewart and Cy Braum of the JCET staff. He explained that the
Center needed an engineer for the Network and a staff in Washington
to advise the Center on positions it should take on national
issues.
